data.chText: （车辆、发动机或机器排出的）废气
data.enText: waste gases that come out of a vehicle, an engine or a machine

data.chText: 汽车排出的废气；汽车排放物

data.enText: a pipe through which exhaust gases come out

data.chText: 我的汽车需要一个新排气管。
data.enText: My car needs a new exhaust.

data.chText: 使筋疲力尽；使疲惫不堪
data.enText: to make sb feel very tired

data.chText: 即使走一段短路，她也疲惫不堪。
data.enText: Even a short walk exhausted her.

data.chText: 你不必筋疲力尽地收拾——我们会做的。
data.enText: There's no need to exhaust yourself clearing up─we'll do it.
to use all of sth so that there is none left

data.chText: 他们在三天之内就把所有粮食吃光了。
data.enText: Within three days they had exhausted their supply of food.

data.chText: 只要还有可能就别放弃。
data.enText: Don't give up until you have exhausted all the possibilities.
to talk about or study a subject until there is nothing else to say about it

data.chText: 我认为我们已把那个题目讨论透彻了。
data.enText: I think we've exhausted that particular topic.

simple_means.memory_skill: ex 出 + haust 抽水 → 抽出 → 抽干

means: (车辆、发动机或机器排出的)废气

tr: system consisting of the parts of an engine through which burned gases or steam are discharged
gases ejected from an engine as waste products

example: This kind of work exhausts me
He was all washed up after the exam
combustion products are exhausted in the engine

tr: use up the whole supply of
example: We have exhausted the food supplies
this car consumes a lot of gas
They run through 20 bottles of wine a week
We quickly played out our strength

value.def: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left.

example.ex: He took to walking long distances in an attempt to physically exhaust himself.
example.tran: 他开始长距离步行，试图耗尽自己的体力。

value.tran: 使精疲力竭;使疲惫不堪

example.ex: She was too exhausted and distressed to talk about the tragedy.
example.tran: 她太累了，而且无比悲伤，没法谈论那场悲剧。

example.ex: It was an exhausting schedule she had set herself.
example.tran: 她给自己安排了叫人筋疲力尽的日程。

value.def: If you exhaust something such as money or food, you use or finish it all.

example.ex: We have exhausted all our material resources...
example.tran: 我们已经耗尽了所有的物资。

example.ex: They said that food supplies were almost exhausted.
example.tran: 他们说供应的食物几乎快要吃完了。

value.def: If you have exhausted a subject or topic, you have talked about it so much that there is nothing more to say about it.

example.ex: She and Chantal must have exhausted the subject of babies and clothes.
example.tran: 她和尚塔尔肯定已经充分讨论过宝宝和衣服的问题。

value.tran: 详尽地讨论;详尽无遗地论述

value.def: The exhaust or the exhaust pipe is the pipe which carries the gas out of the engine of a vehicle.
Exhaust is the gas or steam that is produced when the engine of a vehicle is running.

example.tran: 汽车发动机排放的尾气

example.ex: The city's streets are filthy and choked with exhaust fumes.
example.tran: 那座城市的街道肮脏不堪，弥漫着令人窒息的废气。

example.ex: ...the concentration of car exhausts in the Los Angeles area.
example.tran: 洛杉矶地区汽车尾气的浓度

trans: 废气再循环；废气再循环装置
排气压力；排汽压力；排气口压力

partsOfSpeech.dec: ex 出 + haust 抽水 → 抽出 → 抽干
exhaust 用尽；抽干 + ed 表形容词 →〔力气〕被抽干了 → 筋疲力尽的
in 进入 + haust 抽水 → 抽进 → 吸
